brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the effectiveness of a Relaxation Response
      Intervention for Depression offered to low income populations at Massachusetts General
      Hospital (MGH) - Chelsea, Revere and Charlestown health centers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Medical Record Review of Mind Body Depression Group Participants

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a retrospective review of medical records. The study aims to evaluate the effects of
      participation in the Relaxation Response Intervention for Depression Clinical groups, on
      patient measures of: 1) depression, anxiety and perceived stress; 2) work productivity and
      activity impairment; 3) demand for, and adherence to behavioral medicine; 4) medication use
      for depression and/or anxiety; and 5) dose-response effects.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients receiving care through MGH-Health Centers

          -  a diagnosis of depression and/or anxiety

          -  21 years of age or older

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

study_pop.textblock:
MGH-Health Center patients who have participated in the Relaxation Response Intervention
        for Depression groups.

clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Medical Record Review of Mind Body Depression Group Participants

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Depression scales (CES-D 10) at 8 weeks
Change from baseline Anxiety Scales (STAI-20) at 8 weeks
Change from baseline in Perceived Stress Scale (PSS-10) at 8 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Research at the Benson-Henry Institute for Mind Body Medicine

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective
